content.location: At the far right end of the PT Barnum Wall a 4th class scramble leads to an exposed ledge. The furthest left route.

climbs.name: Party On Sean
climbs.fa: Kevin Calder, Sean Plunkett, Shelly Mayfield

content.description: An off the beaten path moderate worth seeking out.  4th class to the top of a large block on the North side of the wall.  Climb the juggy, yet sporty face.  The position is terrific.
content.location: Approach from the south via a scramble.

climbs.name: Micro Pete
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, Mike Strassman, Marty Lewis

content.description:
A short arête that packs a punch at the top.  Features teetery arête climbing that sports some unique movement for the gorge.  This is not a standard crimp rig.

It would be a hard onsight w/o chalk on it, which is likely due to its obscurity.  If you like short climbs, this is an off the beaten path gem.
content.protection: 5 bolts to ledge.  Anchors are on wall 10 feet back.  Anchors should be lower.  Easy to set up a TR on by walking up backside via P.T. Barnum Wall.

content.description:
start up the bigger crack just right of badda bing. thinner climbing around 40' up for a body length, then fun climbing on big holds to anchor.

this anchor can also be reached from badda bing on the way down, if yall wanna top rope the route
handcrack start seems hard for a warmup, but get through this and interesting stemming, then awesome big hold face makes it worth doing

This can be done in 2 pitches, 5.10a 1st, and 10c second, Or really fun as a 40m pitch.

long draws and slings helpfull. 18 bolts.

To keep the rope dry when pulling clip JUST the chain draws on the way down and pull that side of the rope

access good even at higher flows via boulder hopping. no sun in winter however

This is one of the greatest 5.10 pitches ever, anywhere.
content.location: Look for the largest boulders in a big cascade across canyon from lat machine, small trail will be visible to take you to the base of 3 new routes. This is the leftmost, finger crack start.
